main event: Witnesses observed a round object approximately the size of an automobile flying near Wilmington, Ohio, on June 22, 1956.
interesting points: The object had a bright silver aluminum color and a canopy-like bulge on top., Observations indicated the object seemed about 2-3 feet thick and made no noise., Sightings lasted only 3-4 seconds before the object disappeared over the horizon., The witnesses included a 66-year-old man and his two sons who confirmed their sighting., Investigators concluded it could have been a balloon, astronomical object, aircraft, or unknown.
sighted object: a round object resembling an automobile
witness description: a 66-year-old man and his two sons
